item.title: This Is the Only Card Trump Can Play
item.description: Minneapolis in 2026 is starting to look like Boston in the 1770s.

item.title: Trump’s Second Term Has Ended the Conservative Era
item.description: The right’s future is all about American nationalism.

item.title: Will 2026 Be the Year Voters Pull the Emergency Brake?
item.description: The midterms will be a battle for control of Trump’s legacy.

item.title: Behold Donald of Deliria!
item.description: Trump, sinking into the quicksand of imperialism.

item.title: No, Trump Can’t Cancel the Midterms
item.description: Despite how much the president talks about canceling the 2026 midterms, the columnist Jamelle Bouie explains why he can’t on this episode of “The Opinions.”

item.title: The High Cost of ICE’s Low Standards
item.description: By doubling its force while slashing training time, ICE has scaled up its culture of violence into an unrestrained and unaccountable machine.

item.title: MAGA After Trump
item.description: The president’s approval rating is a misleading signal, argues the columnist David French on “The Opinions.” Without Trump on the ballot, midterm elections will expose the true strength — or weakness — of MAGA politics.

item.title: How War With China Begins
item.description: Even more likely than an all-out invasion of Taiwan may be “gray zone” pressures, such as cutting internet cables.

item.title: One Year In, Trump’s Attack on American Justice is Accelerating
item.description: One year into the president’s second term, America risks losing a central feature of our democracy: that we are a country ruled by laws, not by the whims of one man.

item.title: You’re Never Too Young to Love the Grateful Dead
item.description: I was interested in the lost world this music conjured, a world of teenagers like my aunts who had left home young and hit the road.

item.title: In Search of Love and Meaning in a Changing World
item.description: Readers respond to a column by David Brooks.

item.title: Will 2026 Be the Year Voters Pull the Emergency Brake?
item.description: The midterms will be a battle for control of Trump’s legacy.

item.title: Trump Picked the Right Stage to Act Out His Imperial Ambitions
item.description: For presidents of both parties, Latin America has served as a wellspring of perpetual reinvention and the source of much of their ideological creativity.

item.title: By Raiding a Reporter’s Home, Is the F.B.I. Is Weaponizing National Security?
item.description: Knowing what the government is up to is essential for democracy to work.

item.title: The Underachiever in Chief?
item.description: How much has Trump actually accomplished one year into his second term? According to the conservative analyst Yuval Levin, not much.

item.title: What Kind of Immigration Enforcement Is Legitimate?
item.description: As ICE’s approach to immigration enforcement faces mounting criticism, Ross Douthat, the host of “Interesting Times,” asks the Minneapolis activist Francisco Segovia what legitimate immigration enforcement might look like.

item.title: Conservative Politics Can’t Just Be About Hate
item.description: Politics in America has taken an ugly turn, the conservative analyst Yuval Levin says on “The Ezra Klein Show,” arguing it has become too influenced by fear.

item.title: Democrats Will Lose in 2028 Unless They Change Course Now
item.description: Despite the successes of 2025, the party still needs a radical shake-up.

item.title: Renee Good’s Family Should Be Able to Sue the Officer Who Killed Her
item.description: An ICE killing in Minneapolis can be the impetus for finally closing a gaping hole in our constitutional protections.

item.title: The Right Is Furious With Liberal White Women
item.description: In the MAGA imagination, white women are supposed to be helpmeets, not harpies.

item.title: ‘Dilbert' Cartoonist Scott Adams Was Always MAGA
item.description: My visit with Scott Adams, who anticipated Donald Trump with his comic strip.

item.title: How to Train Citizens to Observe ICE
item.description: What does training to document ICE actions look like? On “Interesting Times,” one activist explains how his Minneapolis-based nonprofit teaches citizens to be constitutional observers.

item.title: Iran’s Regime Is Losing Its Greatest Weapon: Fear
item.description: The bulwark of Iranian oppression is fear. The latest round of demonstrations shows it has been breached.

item.title: A Conservative Critiques Trump’s First Year
item.description: The conservative political analyst Yuval Levin gives Ezra Klein his review of Trump’s first year back in office.

item.title: Trump’s New Military Threat to Minnesota
item.description: Readers react to the unrest in Minnesota. Also: Parallels to the past; the Nobel Peace Prize medal; nuclear power; Bob Weir and the Grateful Dead.

item.title: Dear America, Greenland Is Not on Zillow
item.description: Trump wants Greenland? Its previous colonizer has some thoughts.

item.title: Dear America, Greenland Is Not on Zillow
item.description: Trump wants Greenland? Its previous colonizer has some thoughts.

item.title: 2 Polling Experts on How the ICE Shooting Is More Trouble for Trump
item.description: The general sense of the world being chaotic does not necessarily help Trump.

item.title: Fear of Venezuelan Oil Loss Is Stalking Cubans
item.description: The electricity may go off, but islanders see a glimmer of hope in Maduro’s departure.

item.title: Iran’s Murderous Regime Is Irredeemable
item.description: The protest movement represents the best hope for a government that does less damage in the world and better serves its own citizens.

item.title: Dear Trump, Buying Greenland Is a Bad Idea
item.description: Trump wants Greenland? Its previous colonizer has some thoughts.

item.title: This Is How Your Mind Works
item.description: Our thoughts are an ever-changing swirl of fears, feelings, desires, impulses, memories and body sensations that interact to form a single mind.

item.title: Minneapolis Feels ‘Like Being in a Civil War’
item.description: Documenting ICE is dangerous. This man wants you to do it anyway.

item.title: Forget Trump’s Tariffs. The Real Danger Lies in China’s Trade Surplus.
item.description: China has announced a more than trillion-dollar trade surplus that poses a greater danger to world commerce than Trump’s tariffs.

item.title: They Were Ordinary Germans. We Are Ordinary Americans.
item.description: We are the bystanders this time.

item.title: ICE Is Losing the Political Battle
item.description: “When I look at the ICE operation in Minnesota,” says the Opinion columnist Jamelle Bouie, “I see a White House that is panicking and that is losing.”

item.title: Something Is Rotten in the State of America
item.description: This is the thanks Denmark gets?

item.title: This Is Not How a Normal President Speaks
item.description: The president’s assertion of unlimited authority is a total rejection of popular sovereignty and the logic of the Constitution.

item.title: The Geopolitics of Greenland and NATO
item.description: Readers respond to articles about the U.S. threats against Greenland. Also: A woman’s aging face.

item.title: Trump’s War on Climate Is Thumping Detroit
item.description: The president’s hostility to E.V.s is hurting U.S. automakers.

item.title: The Gaudy, Nasty Fictions of Donald J. Trump
item.description: This is neither law nor order, and the consequences can be deadly.

item.title: Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of Unhappiness
item.description: One reason for the toxicity of American politics may be that our quality of life is slipping behind our peers’.

item.title: Mary Peltola Puts Alaska in Play for Democrats
item.description: Mary Peltola’s entry into the Alaska Senate race is a building block in an electoral strategy Democrats have been working on for months.

item.title: American Citizens Are Living in Fear
item.description: Readers share their anxieties over the aggressive tactics of ICE agents. Also: Undermining the Fed’s stability; one reader’s Trump quiz.

item.title: ICE Is Waging War on Blue Cities
item.description: Will the agency’s brutality and capriciousness create blowback?

item.title: Public Shame Is the Most Effective Tool for Battling Big Tech
item.description: Our federal government won’t regulate fast enough (or at all), but that doesn’t mean regular Americans are helpless.

item.title: A Venezuelan Economist on What Trump Gets Wrong About Venezuela
item.description: Trump thinks he can run the oil. Does he have what it takes to run the country?
